definition[0]: to deliberately put or keep something or someone in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found
example[0]: Marcia hid the pictures in her desk drawer.
example[1]: She keeps a bottle of gin hidden behind a stack of books.
example[2]: He was accused of trying to hide evidence from the police.
definition[1]: to cover something so that it cannot be seen clearly
example[3]: The church roof was half hidden by trees.
example[4]: Her tangled hair hid her face.
definition[2]: to go or stay in a place where no one will see or find you
example[5]: Quick, he’s coming! We’d better hide.
example[7]: Weiss spent two years hiding from the Nazis.
definition[3]: to keep someone in a place where other people will not find them
example[8]: The old woman hid him in her cellar for three days.
example[9]: We’ll have to hide him from the soldiers.
definition[4]: to keep your real feelings, plans, or the truth secret, so that they cannot be known by other people
example[10]: He took off his ring to hide the fact that he was married.
example[11]: He told the jury that he is innocent and has nothing to hide.
example[12]: She laughed to hide her nervousness.
example[13]: Don’t try to hide anything from me.
definition[5]: to make something difficult to see or find, or to not show your true feelings
example[14]: He hid the gun in his pocket.
example[15]: She tried to hide her anger.
example[16]: The actress put up a hand to hide her face from the cameras.
definition[6]: to hide something, especially by carefully putting it somewhere. Also used when talking about hiding your feelings, especially in negative sentences
example[17]: Several kilos of drugs were concealed in the back of the truck.
example[18]: He could not conceal his feelings any longer.
example[19]: The girl quickly concealed the photograph she had been gazing at.
definition[7]: to put something over another thing that you do not want people to see, in order to hide it completely
example[20]: People cover up cracks with wallpaper or tiles.
example[21]: I used some make-up to cover up the spots.
example[22]: She was wearing a thin shawl to cover up the bruises on her arm.
definition[8]: to make someone or something seem like a different person or thing, so that other people cannot recognize them
example[23]: She managed to get into the camp by disguising herself as a soldier.
example[24]: The men had disguised the vessel as fishing boat.
definition[9]: to hide something by covering it with materials that make it look like the things around it
example[25]: We camouflaged the plane by covering it with leaves.
example[26]: The troops used charcoal to camouflage their faces.
example[27]: Soldiers had camouflaged the trucks with branches and dirt.
definition[10]: to make it difficult to see something clearly
example[28]: The view was obscured by mist.
example[29]: His body was found, partially obscured by bushes, at the bottom of a shallow canyon.
definition[11]: to make something less noticeable, for example a taste, a smell, a sound, or a feeling
example[30]: The lemon helps to mask the taste of the fish.
example[31]: Helen had turned on the radio to mask the noise of the traffic.
example[32]: He did little to mask his contempt.
definition[12]: a place from which you can watch animals or birds without being seen by them
definition[13]: an animal’s skin, especially when it has been removed to be used for leather
